definition: see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Sarah Palin (1964-), US Republican politician, State governor of Alaska from 2006

sentences.english: Sarah and Tom arrived this morning with little Tessie .
sentences.chinese: 今早莎拉和汤姆带着小泰西也赶到了。

sentences.english: Where did Borden and Sarah firstly meet?
sentences.chinese: 波登和莎拉首次见面是在哪里？

sentences.chinese: 美联社，莎拉和梅贝尔卡特知道，经济非常不景气。

sentences.chinese: 莎拉，我对你的爱永无止尽。

sentences.english: Wearing a bikini, Sara tries to get Scuderi to take her to his suite.

sentences.english: Michael goes to Chicago to seek out Sara'sfamily friend Bennett.

sentences.english: When we’re talking about Maserati we’re talking about luxury sports cars.

sentences.chinese: 仆人们拿来了莎拉，放在了茱莉亚的面前。

sentences.chinese: 莎拉握住她的写生簿和一支铅笔，开始写和画。

sentences.english: I asked Nathalie if she remembered Sarah Dufaure at all.
sentences.chinese: 我问娜莎莉是否还记得莎拉的事情。
